Package jpacman.controller

This package contains the controller as well as the viewers of the Pacman implementation.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
IMonsterController Interface for a controller which generates a monster move at regular intervals.
 

Class Summary
AbstractMonsterController A controller which generates a monster move at regular intervals.
Animator The primary responsibility of this class is to trigger the board viewer to display the next animation.
BoardViewer A simple way to paint a pacman board.
ImageFactory The responsibilities of this class include obtaining images from file, that can be used for animations of the player and the monsters in Pacman.
Pacman Top level Pacman class.
PacmanUI Construct the top level GUI.
RandomMonsterMover Example, simple monster mover that just moves monsters randomly.
 

Package jpacman.controller Description

This package contains the controller as well as the viewers of the Pacman implementation. The viewers help to display the board, and a panel containing the various buttons. The controllers rely on Swing to get user interaction, as well as on controllers for moving monsters, and triggering animations. Since the Swing controllers are tightly integrated with the gui viewers, we decided to keep controllers and viewers in a single package.

Version:
